paper_title: Lp bounds for Stein's spherical maximal operators
abstract:
Let ${\frak M}^α$ be the spherical maximal operators of complex order $α$ on ${\mathbb R^n}$. In this article we show that when $n\geq 2$, suppose \begin{eqnarray*} \|{\frak M}^α f \|_{L^p({\mathbb R^n})} \leq C\|f \|_{L^p({\mathbb R^n})} \end{eqnarray*} holds for some $α$ and $p\geq 2$, then we must have ${\rm Re}\,α\geq \max \{1/p-(n-1)/2,\ -(n-1)/p \}.$ When $n=2$, we prove that
  $\|{\frak M}^α f \|_{L^p({\mathbb R^2})} \leq C\|f \|_{L^p({\mathbb R^2})}$ if ${\rm Re}\ \! α>\max\{1/p-1/2,\ -1/p\}$, and hence the range of $α$ is sharp in the sense the estimate fails for ${\rm Re}\ α<\max\{1/p-1/2, -1/ p\}.$
